briefTitle: Safety and Tolerability of Ferric Carboxymaltose (FCM) Versus Standard of Care in Treating Iron Deficiency Anemia

armGroups.label: Standard Medical Care (SMC) for the treatment of IDA
interventionNames: Drug: Standard Medical Care (SMC) for the treatment of IDA

interventions.name: Standard Medical Care (SMC) for the treatment of IDA

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subjects ≥ 18 years of age and able to give informed consent
* Iron deficiency is the primary etiology of anemia
* Screening Visit central laboratory Hemoglobin (Hgb) ≤ 11g/dL
* Screening Visit ferritin ≤ 100ng/mL or ≤ 300 ng/mL when TSAT was ≤ 30%

Exclusion Criteria:

* Previous participation in a FCM trial
* Known hypersensitivity reaction to FCM
* Requires dialysis for treatment of chronic kidney disease
* Current anemia not attributed to iron deficiency
* Received IV iron, RBC transfusion(s), or antibiotics 10 days prior and during the screening phase
* Anticipated need for surgery
* AST or ALT greater than 1.5 times the upper limit of normal
* Received an investigational drug within 30 days of screening
* Pregnant or sexually-active females who are not willing to use an effective form of birth control

outcomeMeasures.title: Safety, as Defined by the Occurence of Serious Adverse Events (SAE's), of FCM Compared to SMC
outcomeMeasures.description: Safety, as defined by the occurence of serious adverse events (SAE's), of FCM compared to SMC in the treatment of IDA in subjects who were not dialysis dependent
